poem:
The Pirates' Revival

In a sea of tradition,  
guttural laughter sets sail,  
pirates' hats cartwheel  
upon forgotten words,  
Leigh's echoes dance  
between stern and bow.  
An opera house,  
a ship in harbor—  
not another tempest,  
but waves of nostalgia,  
where joy takes  
center stage,  
under an ancient,  
burnished sky.
